column4: Device has full coverage
Power-only cable used
Older vehicle with unknown diagnostics support / outdated protocol
Supports J1850 or K-Line and is unsupported by Samsara hardware
Feature flag may be impacting operation of the VG
Vehicle has an India spec'd OBDII, requires further investigation
Vehicle has a Japan spec'd OBDII, requires further investigation
New cable type required for diagnostics

A hardware upgrade is recommended when there is a known installation that gives higher P0 diagnostic coverage for a given market. In this case, we will recommend a swap in order to increase our P0 diagnostics in a given region for a given powertrain.
CHGV or FMS cable required, further investigation needed.
Volvo-Mack Cable required, CET updates.
VDP protocol detection needs to be enabled on OBD cable

Vehicle is required to be configured for interoperation with third party telematics devices, including the VG. Customer must be notified to setup their vehicle correctly. This is currently required for Tesla vehicles
VIN missing but user entered license plate. May have fallback for lookup. See MX https://www2.repuve.gob.mx:8443/ciudadania/ or NHTSA in US
Vehicle not connected
Engine state unavailable
VIN does not exist and we do not know what the vehicle is.
VIN exists from ECM but does not adhere to ISO 3779 format.
VIN exists from user entry but does not adhere to ISO 3779 format.

VIN exists but decoding is incomplete and the WMI/VDS group is too small to consider for reverse engineering the VIN itself. We require at least 10 vehicles with the same properties to consider for reverse engineering.
VIN decode missing vehicle make
VIN decode missing vehicle model
VIN decode missing vehicle year
VIN decoded year is invalid or not possible. Must be from 1981 to the current year + 10 years
Engine type missing (ie. ICE, BEV, etc)
Fuel type missing (ie. Diesel, Gasoline, etc)
Vehicle is unable to calculate a derived signal and does not support it natively
Vehicle unable to report data and invesitgation already complete by automotive. No known solution
No fuel level available on the vehicle, requires alternative hardware.
Not enough make models to consider reverse engineering. At least 30 of the same make/model combinations must exist in customer fleets for us to consider a vehicle for reverse engineering.
Detected missing diagnostics on valid installation
